result.description:
Location records store the address and contact details for each site in your organization. Various applications use locations to locate users, facilities, or configuration items (CIs). Create or Import location data to help your teams understand where users are based for location-based task routing, reporting on issues by location, locations with training requirements, new equipment rollouts, and so on.
Create or populate data in the target Location [cmn_location] table.
result.name: Set up locations

result.description:
On-call scheduling enables you to determine who is the current primary contact for a task and to escalate notifications for a group. It provides the ability to set up on-call schedules, rotations, and escalation policies to ensure coverage based on business needs.
In this workspace, you can reach out to experts on-call to get help and accelerate incident resolution. Based on the CI and Service selected on the incident, on-call experts are recommended. You can also search for on-call experts from groups that are not listed.
result.name: Set up on-call schedules

result.description:
Agent Chat enables agents to interact directly with end-users using the chat functionality. Your users can use the Live Agent widget on any portal page for chat conversations. The chat system starts with a virtual chat, which is an autonomous chat powered by artificial intelligence. When a user requests to chat with a live agent on Agent Chat, the request goes into a queue controlled by Advanced Work Assignment (AWA), which routes chats to different agents based on availability, queue length, and expertise. Through Agent Chat, agents communicate with users, create incident or case records, or transfer chats to another agent or queue.
The workspace displays a chat inbox icon that agents use to enter chats. Agents set their status to Available or Away to open or close their inbox for chat requests. The icon displays numbers when chats are waiting to be answered.
The chat interface is integrated with the workspace so agents can chat while using all other features provided by the workspace.
result.name: Set up Agent Chat

result.description: Prioritization is an important aspect of logging an incident as this determines how the incident is handled by support groups and drives service level agreements. Priority is determined by impact (effect an incident has on business) and urgency (the extent to which the resolution of the incident can bear delay)
result.name: Configure prioritization look up rules

result.description:
Categorizing incidents helps in understanding the impact of an incident. When the categorization is accurate, you can use the information for routing incidents to the right team, identify trends over time, improve knowledge searches, and improve process and service efficiency. You can use the category and subcategory fields to categorize an incident. However, it is only recommended to be used where the CMDB (Configuration Management Databases) is not configured. 
The CMDB (CI fields) such as Service, Service offering, and Configuration item can also be used to categorize an incident. Service or CI information is available across all ITSM processes, and therefore it must be related to an incident to provide accurate insight into the performance and health of the service.
 Incidents can be categorized either automatically by using the existing machine learning solution definitions or by an agent using the Service, CI, and Category fields of the incident.
result.sys_name: Configure fields to categorize an incident
result.name: Configure fields to categorize an incident

result.description: Agents can add frequently visited internal or external URLs for quick reference. Agents can add, remove, or edit these links to personalize their view.
result.name: Configure quick links

result.description: An agent with the itil role can effectively manage the lifecycle of incidents, requests, and walk-up appointments in Service Operations Workspace.
result.name: Users and roles

result.description:
A service level agreement (SLA) defines the agreement and formal commitments between a service provider and a customer. The agreement documents the service to be provided or received, the agreed-upon service levels for the service, and the means of measuring or quantifying the level of service. The ability to resolve incidents in a specified time is a key part of delivering an agreed level of service.
In this workspace, the response and resolution timers are available on the Record Information contextual side panel. You have to configure SLA timer configuration mappings for Incident Response and Incident Resolution timer configurations
result.sys_name: Configure Service Level Agreements (SLAs) for Incident Management
result.name: Configure Service Level Agreements (SLAs) for Incident Management

result.description: Learn about key features in Service operations Workspace such as the purpose-built landing page for service desk agents, tailored recommendations, on-call experts, MS Teams chat integration, and an overall improved user experience for agents managing interactions, incidents, requests, and walk-up interactions,
result.name: Key features

result.description: You can configure the landing page header to show personalized messages. By default, we display the current and upcoming agent or on-call shift information depending on the plugins activated in the systems. If the agent and on-call shifts are not configured, we show personalized messages based on the KPIs and agent’s performance.
result.sys_name: Modify the greeting text in the header
result.name: Modify the greeting text in the header

result.description:
Learn how interactions can be managed in ServiceNow. 
In ServiceNow, interaction is a request for assistance made through chat, phone, or in person. You can create an interaction each time a user contacts the Service Desk. The Service Desk agent can take specific actions to assist the user, for example:
•	Resolve the issue by sharing a knowledge article without creating an incident.
•	Provide an update on an existing incident and associate the current interaction with that incident.
•	Create an incident if the issue cannot be resolved immediately and further investigation is required.
•	Submit a request on behalf of the user.
Interactions are a centralized location for all communication channels on the platform.  the interaction records are used for incoming assistance requests and outgoing chat conversations between the IT and caller/requester.
result.name: Manage interactions

result.description: An Incident can be created in ServiceNow via different channels such as the web application, self-service form, integrations, chat, inbound email, walk-up experience, and change. You can configure the incident form to capture relevant information regardless of the channel.
result.name: Create an incident

result.description: Incident overview provides a high-level summary of the incident, including the impact, cause, and resolution notes.
result.name: Customize the incident overview

result.description: To make visual styling changes to the sub pages in the Service Operations Workspace landing page
result.name: Customize the landing page

result.description: This section displays all learning courses that the agent should complete.
result.name: Configure the Learning tasks section

result.description: In the Overview section, the agent can look at the work that is assigned to the agent or the agent’s team. This section includes incident and catalog tasks assigned to the agents and their teams, unassigned incidents, and incident by SLAs.
result.name: Configure the Overview section

result.description: The default landing page is purpose-built for Service Desk agents. All other itil users who are not members of the Service Desk are redirected to Dashboards to see all the dashboards shared with them and the ones they own.
result.sys_name: Redirect the Service Desk agents to the landing page
result.name: Redirect the Service Desk agents to the landing page

result.description:
A group is a set of users who share a common purpose. Group information is used across most processes in the platform for assigning work to teams, requesting approvals, and so on. 
Create or populate data in the target group [sys_user_group] table.
result.name: Create groups

result.description: The Upcoming section shows a list of either due or overdue tasks for the current and next day. If you have activated Workforce Optimization for ITSM, you will also see learning tasks, time-off requests, shifts details, and so on.
result.name: Configure the Upcoming section

result.description: Incident record information provides contextual and actionable information such as the source of the incident, active SLA timers, and a list of collaborators on the incident.
result.sys_name: Customize the incident record Information from the contextual side panel
result.name: Customize the incident record Information from the contextual side panel

result.description: Service Operations Workspace brings together IT Operations and IT Service Management capabilities to provide a unified experience and a reinvented core that enables modern best practices to automate and improve service reliability. With Service Operations workspace, you can streamline your IT Service Management workflows and processes for modern operations. You can effectively manage the lifecycle of incidents, requests, and walk-up appointments in this workspace.
result.sys_name: Get started with Service Operations Workspace
result.name: Get started with Service Operations Workspace

result.description:
ITSM Virtual Agent enables your technicians to concentrate on more challenging and demanding user requests and incidents. ITSM Virtual Agent enhances the employee experience by addressing IT-related queries immediately. During a virtual conversation, a user can request to interact with a live IT technician at any time.
Several predefined ITSM Virtual Agent topic conversations covering common IT interactions, are included with the base system application. These conversations run in the web chat client and supported ITSM Virtual Agent messaging integrations.
Conversations represent dialogs between the virtual agent and the user to accomplish a specific goal. The information exchanged during the conversation flow, such as user inputs and virtual agent responses, enables the virtual agent to fulfill a request or help complete a task.
result.sys_name: Improve agent productivity with ITSM Virtual Agent
result.name: Improve agent productivity with ITSM Virtual Agent

result.description: Agents can view and manage their performance by reviewing the KPIs, current scores, and targets set by their manager.
result.sys_name: Configure metrics in the My performance section
result.name: Configure metrics in the My performance section

result.description: Configure the interaction form in Service Operations Workspace for your use case.
result.name: Configure the interaction form view

result.description:
Learn how incidents can be managed in ServiceNow. 
An incident represents an unplanned interruption or a reduction in the quality service - Incidents can include failures or degradation of services reported by users, technical staff, third-party suppliers and partners, or automatically from monitoring tools. Incident Management helps restore normal service operations as quickly as possible after an unplanned interruption and helps minimize the impact to your business.
result.name: Respond to incidents

result.description: Advanced Work Assignment (AWA) helps to automatically assign work items to your agents based on their availability, capacity, and skills (if defined). You can define different service channels to request assistance,such as chat, cases, and incidents with individual agent capacity and utilization conditions. AWA pushes work to qualified agents using work item queues, routing conditions, and assignment criteria that you define. Agents see their assignments in their Agent Workspace inbox.
result.sys_name: Assign work with Advanced Work Assignment
result.name: Assign work with Advanced Work Assignment

result.description: This section covers a set of core capabilities that will help you work with Service Operations Workspace. Learn about the foundational data setup that powers the workflows and processes for modern operations. Start setting up your users, groups, roles, departments, locations, and so on that can be used within Service Operations Workspace.
result.sys_name: Set up foundation data for Service Operations Workspace
result.name: Set up foundation data for Service Operations Workspace

result.description:
Departments are another way of categorizing a company's users, groups, and assets. Departments should be created for task assignment, allocating the cost of an incident to the department of the caller, offering services by department, and so on.  
Create or populate data in the target Department [cmn_department] table.
result.name: Set up departments

result.description: Requester information provides requester context that includes department, location, time zone, and so on for personalized responses. Active incidents and requests for the requester are visible so that agent can associate the interaction with an existing open record. This section also shows a list of recent incoming and outgoing interactions to help understand what the requester recently needed help with.
result.sys_name: Configure requester information in the contextual side panel
result.name: Configure requester information in the contextual side panel

result.description: You can use announcements to broadcast messages to workspace users. By default, you will see announcements for outages and major incidents if the respective plugins, Task-Outage Relationship (com.snc.task_outage) and Incident Management - Major Incident Management (com.snc.incident.mim), are activated. Additionally, you can add a configuration to show the banner announcement in this section.
result.name: Configure the Announcements section

result.description:
An incident is assigned to the Service Desk or another support group based on many factors such as channel, service, configuration item, and location of the caller. You can create assignment rules to route incidents to specific teams based on these factors. Assignment rules help reduce the resolution time by automatically assigning an incident to the correct resolution team.
Alternatively, you can use the existing machine learning solution definitions or create  one to predict the assignment group.
result.name: Assign an incident

result.description:
A user record in ServiceNow stores contact, location, organizational information, and more. Upload user data by connecting to Active Directory (AD), integrating with your HR system of record, or manually. 
User data must be accurate to understand the impact of an outage, allocate costs to one or more business entities, and so on.  Populate data in the target user [sys_user] table.
result.name: Import users

result.description: Agents can use tailored recommendations to speed up incident investigation and resolution. For example, the agent can propose a major incident and associate the incident with an existing problem based on similar incidents. Additionally, the system recommends Knowledge Base (KB) articles and similar incidents to help resolve the incident.
result.name: Configure incident recommendations

result.description: Get started with the landing page that is tailored for Service Desk agents. The landing page provides an overview of outages, service announcements, and assignments to efficiently prioritize the work. Additionally, the agents can view and manage their performance and learning tasks assigned by their managers.
result.name: Set up workspace landing page

result.description:
If you have services or products provided or supported by third-party companies, you can define types of companies such as vendors and manufacturers. This data can also be used to report on vendors, CI asset manufacturers, and monitor vendor performance.  
Create or populate data in the target Company [core_company] table.
result.name: Set up companies

result.description: Use our help resources to learn more about Service Operations Workspace.
result.name: Get help

result.description: Agents can collaborate on incidents using MS Teams chat. They can initiate one or more chat conversations with the requester and peers right from the task record. They can view the history of chat conversations related to the record and import messages from an existing chat conversation to the record.
result.sys_name: Set up MS Teams integration for collaboration
result.name: Set up MS Teams integration for collaboration

result.sys_name: Learn how App Engine Studio Works
result.name: Learn how App Engine Studio Works

result.description:
Roles control access to features and capabilities in applications and modules. Grant your IT team members roles that give them access to the functionality required to perform their jobs. Many roles are provided in the base system to help you get started. 
Roles can be applied to individual users or groups. Add roles to groups so that the group members can then inherit them.
result.name: Assign roles
